title: Apoptygma Berzerk - 7[FLAC - LOSSLESS]
description:
Track Listing:
1. Love Never Dies
2. Mourn
3. Non-Stop Violence
4. 25 Cromwell St
5. Rebel
6. Deep Red
7. Nearer
8. Half Asleep
9. Love Never Dies (part 2)
10. Mourn (APB Remix) 

Proving that unbridled aggression isn&#039;t always needed to effectively get one&#039;s point across in industrial dance music, Norway&#039;s Apoptygma Berzerk take a melodic, almost synth-pop-like approach on their second full-length, 7. This domestic issue of an album originally released in Europe in 1996 proves a great introduction to the thoughtful music of Stephan Groth (a.k.a. Grothesk). "Love Never Dies" establishes the gothic tone of the disc, starting things off with grand-guignol organ music that gives way to driving synths and beats, followed by Grothesk&#039;s unprocessed vocals and a few sampled refrains from Carmina Burana. "Mourn," a delicate, stripped-down electro track dedicated to Kurt Cobain, shows off Groth&#039;s talent for melodic songwriting, a rarity in a genre often criticized for its lack of subtlety. Other highlights include the energetic Front 242-isms of "Non-Stop Violence" and the sharp techno inflections of "Deep Red" (complete with Laibach sample!).
